assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: Hifiasm + Hi-C phasing v. 0.16.1 + galaxy2; yahs v. 1.2a + galaxy1

bioprojects.title: Lycodopsis pacificus (blackbelly eelpout) genome, fLycPai1, haplotype 1

attributes.name: collected_by
attributes.value: Scott Hamilton, Moss Landing Marine Laboratories

biosample.collectedBy: Scott Hamilton, Moss Landing Marine Laboratories

description.comment: Blackbelly eelpouts (Lycodopsis pacificus) are Perciformes fishes, that inhabit the Eastern Pacific: from the Gulf of Alaska, south, to northern Baja California, Mexico. They are found on silty or sandy bottoms (from fishbase entry). This sample is from a female in Monterey Bay, California, collected by Scott Hamilton of the Moss Landing Marine Laboratories, coordinated by Joanna Kelley of Washington State University, and used to generate a high-quality reference genome for the Vertebrate Genomes Project (VGP). Sequencing and genome assembly were conducted at the Vertebrate Genomes Lab (VGL) at the Rockefeller University led by Olivier Fedrigo and Erich D. Jarvis.
description.title: Animal sample from Lycodopsis pacificus (blackbelly eelpout) for VGP genome, fLycPai1
